p: Leaf-level WUE did not respond to warming ( F 1,6 = 2.58, P = 0.159) or drought ( F 1,6 = 1.25, P = 0.306) but did respond to their interaction ( F 1,6 = 25.02, P = 0.002; Table 1). WUE decreased in the W + D treatment by 12% relative to ambient ( Fig. 5, Table 2) but was largely explained by random effects (conditional r 2 = 0.98) especially maternal line ( σ 2 = 0.95; Table 3). This further suggests that maternal influence, in part, predicted the ability of plants to adjust WUE in response to warming and drought.
